Avrae BOT 23-May-20 11:35 PM
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 30-May-20 08:33 PM
Irithriel hummed the whole way to the mess hall, the girl immediately running off to the table of sweets once she and Mors got there. “Oh look, my beast!” she exclaimed, her voice soft and pleasant. “They actually have creme brûlée! I’ve not had such a treat since my betrothal to Evindal... his family always served it.” Her face reddened then. Evindal wasn’t someone she liked thinking on. He’d been monstrous, a bully. He’d fed into her brother’s horrible behavior and caused her shame for her family. His treatment had left her quite scarred. That was, until Mors entered her life and made it known she had worth. Giving Mors a sweet smile, Iri started filling up a tray with the decadent delights the mess hall had to offer. Ramekins of the custard treat, bowls of fruit, plates of tarts and cakes. She looked over at her mate and giggled then, happily bringing her filled tray to a nearby table. “Look, my beast. Isn’t it lovely?”
( @Mors | Garg | Bof )
Mors | Garg | Bof 31-May-20 08:13 AM
Mors chuckled when his little elf just ran towards the sweets. He followed after her but at a more relaxed pace, his armor and big size making each step he took be heard around the room. While he moved towards the food, he left his hammer on an empty table so he had both of his hands free. Once he reached her he grabbed another tray after noticing the lots and lots of sweets she was picking. At least there's some fruit. He thought and then chucked when he heard her next words. "It is, little moon." He simply stated while he started to fill his own tray with meat, all kinds of meat and some of those tasty meat like plants he had discovered in the jungle. After he was finished, he also grabbed a jar filled with fresh water and a couple of mugs and followed after her. He finally sat down in the table and like he always did he pulled her onto his lap. "So this is the food those fools used to serve you? At least they were not completely useless." He casually commented before grabbing a steak with his bare hand and taking a bite out of it.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 31-May-20 08:45 AM
Irithriel nestled herself into Mors’ lap, cuddling against him, while she looked over her tray of food. The desserts looked wonderful, tantalizingly glistening in all their glorious presentation. “Yes, my beast. I ate such treats, though not all the time, of course.” She giggled softly then, reaching for her spoon and digging into the decadent dish of creme brûlée. “Mmm...” Iri sighed, her eyes fluttering shut. The girl was clearly enjoying the sweet treat. “I understand why they limit us on this one... the kitchen staff, I mean...” She eagerly took another bite. “I can taste how delightfully bad for me this is!” Again, she giggled and took another mouthful of custard. While Iri ate, she looked at the choices her Mors had made. Her beast was practically a carnivore! Then, that hardly surprised her. He was raw power. He was... her beast. “Tasting good?” she then asked him, hoping he was enjoying his own choices, as much as she was her own. The girl nuzzled him then, before moving to take a sip of the water Mors had gotten them both.
Mors | Garg | Bof 31-May-20 04:32 PM
Mors finished eating the whole steak with only a couple of bites, his other hand resting against Iri's belly where their child was safely growing. He looked down at her and smiled. "Aye little moon..." He said softly before lowering his head and kissing her neck a little. "Not as good as you... But still good..." He growled in her ear before grabbing another piece of meat from his tray, this time it was a big bird's leg, and taking a chunk out if it. "If these sweets please you then we shall have them at our ceremony." He declared after finally noticing how much she was enjoying her meal. "Remember what the healer said. Only you know what our young needs to grow strong." Then he shook his head a little and threw away the half eaten piece of meat, a green minion fell from the roof and caught it in the air. "Go. Take what you want. Gather your strength back." He told his minions and pontied towards the table filled with all kinds of food. The green minions finally did something different from their silent selves and actually cheered after hearing the overlord. With a happy, "Mors!" They all attacked the table, somehow even the two blue minions and the other green one had appeared too and they all went for it making a mess of things and fighting against each other for some of the biggest pieces of meat and some sweets. Mors just sighed and turned his head towards his food again to keep eating and enjoying time with his mate after that long training exercise.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 31-May-20 07:36 PM
“Mmm... oh yes!” Irithriel exclaimed, her mouth a bit full. She giggled then, turning to look up at Mors, while she swallowed down her dessert. “Speaking of our wedding,” she went on. “I was thinking that we should go to the gardens and pick out some flowers. It won’t be much. Just something pretty for a simple decoration.” Her cheeks turned red then, one of her hands moving to rest atop Mors’. She liked how he was also already bonding with their son. Oh... he’d make the best father! She just knew it. The girl then reached for some fruit, taking a bite out of a succulent looking apple. The fruit crunched nicely, some of the juices dripping down her chin. “Oh so good...” she commented softly, her eyes noting the little darlings eating their fill. “So,” she added, her voice a bit louder. “Does that sound good to you, my beast?”
Mors | Garg | Bof 31-May-20 10:11 PM
"Of course little moon. We will gather everything you want for the ceremony. And perhaps order more of this food?" He chuckled softly, noticing how much she was enjoying the meal. By that point he had practically emptied his tray, only a few pieces of meat and that strange plant remained. "Anyone else... you would like to invite?" Mors asked between bites of his remaining meal, still being careful to not move too much and cause his mate to become uncomfortable thanks to his armor. He ussually walked around the ship with only his helmet and sword on his back but since they had come from the training he was still almost completely covered in metal. That reminded him, he needed to commission a secondary one, more "soft" and perhaps more "fancy". "After the ceremony... we need to gather more resources to get new armor." He needed to be able to go around with his children without being concerned about his armor sharp edges and it wouldn't hurt for his mate to have better protection. "And more of those dresses." He finally added, knowing that she would like that idea. In the background the minions kept making a mess while they got their fill of everything but they were all making happy noises.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 31-May-20 11:01 PM
“Oh!” Irithriel immediately squealed, pouncing on Mors’ question about guests. “We definitely need to invite Lonehunter,” she said with a smile. “He’s your new best friend! That makes him an honorary uncle!” The girl seemed absolutely delighted. “You are so lucky to have found two best friends on board this ship. I...” The girl paused a moment and sighed heavily. “I’ve not found any confidantes. Not really.” Her face seemed sad, as she spoke. “Though, I’ll always have you and our little darlings. And, soon our son of course!” Iri didn’t allow the sadness to remain with her long, pushing herself through the moment and onto happier things. She giggled then, the antics of the minions cheering her up like it always did. “Oh, new armor and dresses would be lovely,” she went on, easily moving on with conversation. “I have nearly 400 gold pieces stashed away. So, how much more will we need?” Her mate was always doing something to make her happy and she knew the goliath loved to train, his armor meaning so much to him. So, if she could aid him, she would. Humming softly, Iri then finished her food and took a long draw from her mug of water. Feeling better and refreshed, she just leaned back against Mors and snuggled him. She hardly cared that he was covered mostly in metal. She was his and he was hers, so she’d just do what felt right and natural.

Mors | Garg | Bof 05-Jun-20 05:24 PM
The Guild Master
Just in that moment a particular series of sounds were heard by the group at the table. Clack clack clack They sounds, ones being produced by a walking cane, made the guild members aware of a new arrival. It was Cassius Clay. The old metallic skeleton that was rarely seen outside if his office. "A most joyous occasion. The joining of two souls in the eyes of the law and society. A time to celebrate the end of two lives but the beginning of a family." As always he was the picture of a perfect gentleman. His clothes were classic with a touch of eccentricity. His big hat somehow remained in it's proper place and the walking cane just complimented the whole picture. That is, of course, if one would ignore the eerie sight of a walking mechanical skeletons with a green glow coming from inside his body. "Pardon my timely interruption. It is not every day that an old man finds the answer to one of his problems just under the tip of his nose... Or should I say under the roof of his mess hall?" His voice was polite like always and carried some lighter tones, almost like happy chuckles. Only a couple of more steps were needed for the guildmaster to reach the table where the four of them had gathered. "Mr. Ironhide, Mr. Lonehunter. What a pleasure to meet you again so soon." A small nod of respect was spared for each warrior after their names were said. "Miss Ravenwood. (edited)
It has been quite a while since our last conversation, hasn't it? I am pleased to see the new developments in your life." A more formal now was offered to the elf before his eerie eyes focused on the big armored Goliath holding said elf. "And it is a pleasure you finally become acquainted with Mr. Mors. I formally apologize for such a slight. I am sure that you understand that a man in charge is not always the owner of his own time and since Miss Ravenwood provided such a great tour around this lovely ship I will admit that I had pushed our meeting to the bottom of my priorities and somehow forgot about it... This old mind is sharp but once in a while it likes to show it's true age and cause some trouble for myself." "Once again I formally apologise for that show of disrespectfullness. Allow me to finally formally introduce you to the steel hearts..." Just like with the other two warriors, a small nod was spared for the overlord. "And finally, but not less important, to congratulate the happy couple. Both for their incoming parenthood and impeding nuptials."
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 05-Jun-20 07:52 PM
“It has been,” Irithriel answered, her pale cheeks darkening to a pretty shade of pink. The girl lowered her gray gaze a bit, not used to others truly giving her the time of day. Back in the courts, she was seen as silly, oftentimes a bother. And her family had made it clear she was also quite the burden. It had hurt. Stung. But she never let them see a dampened spirit. Instead, she focused on the beauty of the world, letting the ugliness she knew that existed to fester in some other dark corner. One that wasn’t her own. Iri turned to look up at Mors. She felt a sense of pride having been chosen by him above all others. It made her feel special. Wanted. And most of all, she knew she was very loved. The goliath might look intimidating to most, his booming voice and unnaturally glowing eyes, but the girl knew better. She knew the heart beneath that cold armor and strange markings. As she smiled up at her mate, heart swelling with love and pride, she let her hand find his, bringing it to rest with her own upon her belly, a tender moment with their son, despite the crowd. Quietly, Iri listened to the guild master, noting his quirks and reveling in his kind demeanor. When he finished, having addressed the others in turn, she suddenly gasped with joy. “Oh! You know of our wedding? How lovely!” Again, the pretty elf was bouncing on Mors’ lap, her excitement quite clear. “We are both looking forward to our special day, and...” The girl giggled sweetly. “So is our son.” She blushed harder then, letting out a squeak, as she buried her face against Mors, not caring that he donned cold armor. The Guild Master

Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 08-Jun-20 10:52 PM

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 08-Jun-20 11:43 PM

Mors | Garg | Bof 09-Jun-20 03:08 AM
Mors
The overlord remained silent but smiled pleased when he heard Uthal's words. Good. He thought, the hunter already considered them his allies, one step closer to have him join his armies. Still, he was curious to learn more about the minotaur and it looked like his mate and the hunter were doing a fine job of making him speak. With one arm still wrapped around Irithriel, he used the other to silently grab another one of those sweets and ate it with a single bite. He would never prefer those over meat, but once he had eaten properly to sustain his body... Yeah, he would give it to his mate, those things were enjoyable. The minions kept feasting on the background. At this point it sounded like they were singing a song in that gibberish language of them that only Mors seemed to understand properly, even the silent green assasins had joined the blue ones.
Kor | Zed | Celia 09-Jun-20 01:11 PM
"To keep it short and sweet...I don't particularly hold allegiance to my clan anymore. Petty squabbling and poor leadership don't exactly make for amazing beacons that one wants to crawl back to after seeing the outside world." He gave a shrug as he adjusted his mail again, grunting softly. "And before you ask, there isn't an Ironhide clan anywhere, that name I chose for myself." As he sat there his mind stirred, old memories to the surface of his prior ventures, if one had been looking at him he would have been staring off aimlessly into the air again. Eventually his focus came back to the reality at hand and he let his own hand rhythmically tap against the table in front of him. "I suppose they weren't bad people, just not the life for me...getting angry at your problems and swinging an axe isn't always a solution I can happen to condone these days."
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 09-Jun-20 02:46 PM
Uthal could understand where the Minotaur was coming from; while he himself held no ill will towards his own clan, he understood the desire to leave if the leadership was no good. And if the clan was unwilling to change it, then it was better to strike out on one's own and lead their own life. "I understand your sentiments; it is not easy to leave one's family behind in most circumstances. But if the leadership lacks, and there is no one who works to change it, it is better to never let that hold you back. You were wise to see it; I've seen many fall to corrupt or immature leaders in my travels." Uthal replied, though he chuckled about swinging an axe at your problems. "Perhaps, but rage is a powerful motivator if used correctly."

The Guild Master
"A good leader does not force the ones following their instructions to commit acts that go against their ideals... On the contrary, it is their job to guide them through their own journey of self discovery all while working towards the while group best interests." He added softly, not sounding as happy as before but more calm and collected, like an elder offering some words of wisdom to their offspring. "It is quite sad, yes, they day one find themselves in the need to abandon home to find a place better suited for their needs... It wasn’t until Vanilor was about to give up his search and take his loaded plate with various meats back to his room when he accidentally bumped into a woman he’d soon find out was the one he was looking for; Selaphiel. He listened to her speak and he remained quiet while she did; for he was surprised to have found them so easily and he couldn’t help but wonder on what Cassius had said; and if it was true that it was his destiny to meet these two. “Greetings, Sela” Vanilor said in a warm soft voice while he examined her features, feeling a sense of enamour wash over him. He was surprised at how friendly she was, but he had no intentions of denying her request; every second believing Cassius’ words to be more true. “I would very much like to sit down and talk with you and your companion Bofwant.” He said, yet to reveal his intentions; and unsure if he even would.
Selaphiel Rookwood BOT 12-Jul-20 09:48 PM
Sela smiled up at tiefling and gestured that he follow. The girl set down her tray and immediately reached for Bofwant, her hand giving his shoulder a squeeze. “My love, we’ve a new friend joining us. A tiefling. He seems nice and has a kind face,” she whispered. Before sitting down herself, Sela placed Bofwant’s plate of food and glass of water before him and then did the same for her own meal. She was still quite worried for the man, seeing his eyes wrapped in bandages, his flesh coated with ointments... it was enough to set the girl’s anxiety quite on edge. “So,” Sela went on, looking over at the tiefling and taking a seat. “I don’t think I caught your name, though it’s always nice to meet new people. I’ve not been here too long as of yet, but so far it’s been pleasant.” The red head needed to push out those thoughts of Jarreth. Her past was riddled with darkness. A darkness she wished to somehow snuff out and extinguish forever. She’d thought facing her demons, gaining a patron would be the answer. But it was turning out to be the biggest mistake she’d made yet. “I do hope you’re enjoying your time here,” Sela then added, her hands reaching for her cup. The red headed elf brought the cup to her lips and she sipped on the cool refreshing liquid. After setting it back down, she readjusted her robe, making sure it was secure about her body and firmly in place.
Bofwant BOT 12-Jul-20 10:12 PM
The healer perked up as soon as he felt someone approaching him but relaxed a little when he felt Sela's touch on his bare shoulder. Thanks to the burning sensation he only realizing that he had forgotten about a shirt... Even shoes. Only having a pair sleep pants on him. Good thing that his training had kicked in and he had his sword and healer kit with him under the table. He smiled a little when he heard Sela's words and then the plate of food being placed in front of him. "Good evening." He welcomed this new guild members that had joined them. "I am Bofwant, resident doctor in the #med-bay... I apologise for this but thankfully it is only temporary." The man gestured to the bandages around his eyes before shaking his head a little. "Feel free to pick a seat." After giving this tiefling a few moments to join them, Bofwant slowly reached for his food, finding first the glass of water and taking a very needed drink of the refreshing liquid.
Vanilor BOT 12-Jul-20 10:42 PM
Vanilor followed behind Sela after offering her an affirmative nod, though as he followed her and they drew nearer his eyes became focused on the large man whom was seated and covered in a variety of bandages which were stained by injury, and he couldn’t help but wonder the cause of such great wounds. Vanilor positioned himself on the opposite side of the table so Bofwant could see him clearly, and he them. He smiled toothily as he stood before them and introductions were made; and in return bowed his large head with horns that curled back tightly along his skull. “My name is Vanilor, and the pleasure is all mine.. I wish you a speedy recover Bofwant, I imagine your services are in much demand.” He said with a smile while lowering himself into a seat across from them. He he showed little emotion in his face; it was his tail that gave away his excitement, which had begun to sway side to side faster and perked further upright than before. “My time on the ship thus far has been short, but quite enjoyable. It is a magnificent machine.” There was a brief pause while Vanilor debated exchanging the information Cassius’ had shared, then he cleared his throat and then leaned closer so he could see the pair cleared with his jet black eyes. “I do not wish to alarm you, but I wish to speak the truth — I have sought the both of you out..” He looked from one to the other, maintaining eye contact while he did; though his blackened eyes made it hard to tell where exactly he was looking, though he repositioned his entire body so he was facing Sela and it was clear he was addressing her next. “The Guild Master Cassius believes my destiny to be intertwined with yours.” This was not a phrase Vanilolr would have ever used lightly, being a man of science and research. But everything seemed to be unfolding exactly as if it were meant to.
Selaphiel Rookwood BOT 13-Jul-20 07:52 PM
The longer Sela sat there and listened, the more she began to think on her brother. Her twin. Her other half growing up in that unhealthy home. Her poor cursed Barachiel. She recalled her last visit with her twin, Barachiel telling her about a recurring dream. He’d mentioned a demon, the girl wondering if he too had visions of Jarreth. But her brother had confirmed it hadn’t been the herald. He remembered those horrible nights, unable to help her, while their parents used her to call the creature to their circle. No. His dreams were something else. Something other. The demon not one to fear. Night after night, it was the same thing. And now she was sitting with a tiefling at the table. How peculiar life was to fill her life with the infernal at every corner it could. First dreams, now awake. What would life do next? “Destiny?” Sela squeaked, her golden eyes moving to Vanilor. “Intertwined? The guild master claimed this?” she asked. Clay was eccentric, some might even say odd, and now he was predicting the future. “So he told you to find us. Did he say as to why? I’m nothing special. Just... just an elf...” she muttered, hating how her parents had kept her and Barachiel hidden most of their lives, sequestered away from life and love. From everything. “Though my brother needs help,” Sela went on. “Are you familiar with curses, Vanilor?” The girl wondered if perhaps the guild master thought this tiefling might be able to lift the one on her twin. It was worth asking him at the very least. What did she have to lose?
Bofwant BOT 13-Jul-20 09:38 PM
Bofwant released a pleased sigh after drinking some cool water. He really needed that. While he listened to this new member of the guild, the soldier carefully lowered nhis glass and then used his hands to search for the food on his plate. "Thank you Vanilor. Like I said, this is only temporary." He used one of his hands to touch the bandage over his eyes, he could still feel some.of the burn and see some white spots but everything was certainly improving. "I am just being cautious and as a doctor I have to make an example for others about being careful with ones own health." His other hand found something soft and juicy. Perhaps a piece of fruit, whatever it was he trusted Sela with his life so he picked it up and ate it. He kept slowly eating while he listened to them both speak about destiny and after Sela last words he felt like he needed to say something. "Destiny is a misterious road. I too, ended up in this guild thanks to it, even if I was focused on another thing." He blindly reached for Sela and found her small hand, giving her a small squeeze. "Even if we are common beings on this world filled with wonders... We always have a role to play. A way to help others and be helped in kind, remember?" Yes, even if he too was just a simple human, he didn't think less of himself for that. After that he returned to his previous task of slowly eating, filling his body with needed sustenance to speed up his healing while he listened to what both Sela and Vanilor had to say.
Vanilor BOT 14-Jul-20 01:00 AM
Vanilor composed the same faint smile as he listened to the pair speak; finding each of their words intriguing and listened in silence with wonder. He took note of the way they showed affection to one another and assumed they were bonded by love; nor could he resist the memories of his former lover that washed over him when he saw the large injured man search for her hand. “Aye, he did in a roundabout way. I am not one to foolishly believe in destiny, nor that our stones are already dealt— However, I do believe Cassius to have spoke the truth and I am meant to be here.” Vanilor plucked his mug of ale from the tray infront of him and took a large sip to wet his mouth before continuing. “He did not say what lies in store for our fate, he did not say much.. but he did say something along the lines of uhh—..” He itched at the base of one of the horns protruding from his forehead while trying to think of how Cassius had worded one of the last things he said. “— it is there that you’ll find your next adventure, for I am certain your own fate shall soon follow along with theirs.” He let Cassius words sink in for a moment then began again. “I believe I am here to help you and Bofwant find your brother, Lady Selaphiel.” He lowered his head in a small respectful bow, truly believing this was his “purpose”. Something he hadn’t had in quite some time. ”I can say curses are far from my speciality, however I do have a general understanding from my text readings.”

Parker decides to chill at the mess hall for a while. They're accompanied by Perittós, as has become normal, and intend to play their ukulele, possibly getting some cash in the process. For now, they'll just nurse an ale for a while, and play with the fluffy little Griffin.

Everything is sharper, in odd ways, particularly the scent of what Parker can now recognize as grilled abyssal chicken. Selaphiel Rookwood BOT 15-Jul-20 05:53 AM
Sela frowned a little, realizing this tiefling could possibly have a past far worse than her own. For so long she’d been haunted both in waking and sleeping by demons of such horror, that at times she’d forgotten there were those born into hell. Still, perhaps that meant this one needed help just as much as she and Bofwant did. And being of exotic blood, like herself... maybe he had a more worldly understanding of politics. “My... my brother has been found, Mr Vanilor,” Sela corrected. “Though in many ways he is still lost.” The girl sighed softly, her hand giving Bofwant’s a loving squeeze. “I suppose it’s the Rookwood fate,” she went on, smiling weakly at the sick humor fate had while weaving the web for her and Barachiel. The one steadfast good—her Bofwant. “I am now plagued with patron...” She looked over at Bofwant just then, her golden eyes glistening with tears, as she looked upon her love and those bandages. He’d not be in this mess if not for her blunder. “And my twin... he is plagued with a curse. A terrible curse. He turns into an oni at every full moon, and it only breaks with injury, his time spent as such... lost.” Trying not to cry, Sela reaches for her water and takes a small sip. The action something to occupy her mind and her body, while trying calm her nerves. “We were kept hidden,” she continued. “My brother and I not allowed to know our own blood, our history. I recently and for the first time met my cousin. Sir, know you anything of Feywild rules or politics?” she then asked. If Vanilor looked deep enough into her eyes, he’d see those years of abuse and pain, the heart aches and fear from a lifetime of darkness and hell her own parents had put her through. And all for their own selfish reasons.
Bofwant BOT 15-Jul-20 08:49 AM
Bofwant took a deep breath and nodded. A tired sigh escaping his lips. "Barachiel is stable for the most part. Sadly that night with a full moon, leaves him so physically drained that he prefers to spend his time in the safety of the med bay." It has been a very sad routine so far, specially those days nearing the full moon when the staff had to prepare everything to keep him contained. Once or twice Bofwant had to fight him while he was transformed and not even his holy magic could help with the curse. "Mr. Vanilor, I thank you. Most people would be very opposed to the idea to help others by just some ominous words." Then he returned to his meal, eating slowly thanks to his self imposed blindness. Even if he couldn't watch like a watcher, he could use his other senses and listen. And even if he wanted to offer some comfort to his love, he knew that he had to let her explain her dark past without help, so one day she could overcome it completely. By now he couldn't see any white spots in his vision and the burning pain had dulled to a simple ache. He could feel his body regaining those supernatural gifts he had been granted but even then he was a doctor and knew how fragile a body could be, specially the human one. He would wait a little more to take off his bandages, he decided, just to be in the safe side of things.
Vanilor BOT 15-Jul-20 11:12 AM
Vanilor watched Selaphiel with intent, the pain seeped from her words as much as it did from her face; and it pained him to see such sorrow. Vanilor made no attempt to interrupt either of them speak, instead he waited til the pair had seized their questions and statements, then with intertwined hands laid out on the table, Vanilor spoke. “I apologize for the condition of your brother; and my false assumption.. ” He bowed respectfully, before continuing. “Feywild Rules, and it’s origination I have a general understanding— politics? Not so much.. Since the barrier between these two planes has become much thinner, I take it your brother has been cursed by a creature with the ability to cross plains?” He said, hoping not to appear foolish. He remembered Feywild in his studies, but many things regarding it were vague in his memory. He thought of Bofwants words, and Vanilor too was surprised by his actions; majority of his life consisted of looking out for himself, and only himself; but something about what Cassius’ had said made Vanilor feel as if his fate were entangled with theirs. “It is my pleasure to help the both of you, Bofwant. Any way that I can.” He smiled faintly, and his whole demeanour seemed to relax slightly; most noticeable from the calming of his tail.

Selaphiel Rookwood BOT 15-Jul-20 08:23 PM

Her fingers moved to trace that scar... only now it was gone, thanks to Jarreth’s dark magic. She frowned then, fingers tracing flawless flesh where that scar had once been. “My twin brother had been pulled from my life by an oni. As a child, I’d imagined him to be a large, giant of a... a... demon.” Sela’s golden gaze slid away from Vanilor’s face, fixing on the table instead. I just know we’d found our parents slaughtered and then that creature tried to take me.” She sniffled a bit, eyes damp with unshed tears. “Barachiel sacrificed himself, the oni taking him instead of me.” Her voice wavered a bit, the girl doing her best to stay calm, while she shared this most intimate story. “I’m sorry,” Sela continued. “I don’t mean to bog you down with my woes.” The red head gave Bofwant’s arm a small squeeze and turned toward him for a moment. “Are you feeling better, my love? Do you need anything?”
Reese (Thrin✨Tomara✨Parker) 15-Jul-20 08:35 PM

It's kind of like learning to feel the blood in your veins, except here... It's unfamiar, easier to feel and notice. Have you felt it? The tingling under your skin? It's a lot stronger on the ship, what with the whole thing being filled with magic." (edited)

Bofwant BOT 15-Jul-20 11:25 PM
While Sela and Vanilor traded words, the healer focused on finishing his meal. Little by little he could feel his supernatural strength returning to his body, only a full ache remaining where a painful burning sensation was. "I am feeling better my love.. " he answered softly to Sela's question. It was then that he decided that it was safe enough to remove the bandages over his eyes. Slowly but with the ease of an expert, he removed the bandages and rolled then over so he could clean them later since they only were stained by burnsoothe, a special ointment for burns. He finally opened his brown eyes while looking at Sela. "See, the worst of it already passed..." He tried to reassure her. What he didn't know and she probably noticed was the new golden rim around the brown of his eyes. It could be an after effect of what happened, after all, he had been focusing the power in his eyes so that being couldn't hide from him when that overload of radiance happened. Then he turned his gaze towards Vanilor, finally seeing the tiefling for the first time. "Once again, I thank you Mr. Vanilor... And I give you my word as a watcher over the fallen that if at any moment you shall be in need of my help, I will gladly give it to you as long as it doesn't bring harm to an innocent life."

Vanilor BOT 16-Jul-20 10:36 AM
Vanilor listened to the tale of Barachiel, surprised at what curse had befallen him. He had heard of the “Oni”, but had never seen one first hand; and the thought of facing one sent a shiver down his spine. “Perhaps somewhere more quiet we could discuss that?” He said; briefly scanning around at the various groups of people yellling, trying to be heard over one another. “I fear I may disappoint you though, I am but a young Wizard with much to learn.” Then he turned to Bofwant and watched as the large male unwrapped the soaked bandages around his head. After Bofwant addressed Selaphiel and turned to him Vanilor couldn’t help but look into his eyes, he’d never seen his eyes previously; but for a human they were definitely unique. “I appreciate that, and hope I do not need help anytime soon.” He cracked a wide smirk, though he truly did appreciate the offer; knowing how knowledgeable the Steel Hearts doctor would be.
Selaphiel Rookwood BOT 16-Jul-20 10:49 AM
Sela watched Bofwant remove the bandages, tilting her head, while quizzically looking into the paladin’s eyes. “My love... your... your eyes...” she whispered, daring to reach out, her fingertips just barely brushing his cheek. She then turned to Vanilor and nodded, giving him another of her smiles. “I agree,” Sela stated, a hand resting on Bofwant’s arm. “And I highly doubt you’ll disappoint,” she went on. “I am new to magic myself, I...” The girl winced, knowing Jarreth would now be a sore point, something she and Bofwant would have to fix. But, later. For now, she had to make the best of it. Use it to her advantage and grow strong, much like the Grand General has advised. “I harbor pact magic,” Sela explained. “And I’ve yet to test it out. Perhaps...” Her voice trailed, the girl suddenly lost in thought, while her fingers absently twirled at her red hair. “Perhaps we could all train a bit. Get to know what we each can do and how to best work together.” She looked between Bofwant and Vanilor. “We can discuss further while we train.” Slowly, the girl situated herself and began getting up. “If you’re well enough, my love, let’s go to the #training-hall .”
Bofwant BOT 16-Jul-20 02:53 PM
Bofwant frowned a little when Sela mentioned his eyes but didn't think much of it. Perhaps they were a little irritated, he thought as he was still somewhat sensitive to light. "Do not worry Mr. Vanilor... You would be surprised if what you can do when you use your skills to help others." He reassured the tiefling after a nod of agreement at his words. Then Sela suggestion of training exercise made the soldier smile. "That is an excellent idea my love." He said before getting up and gathering the empty plates and glasses. Yes, somehow he could feel his energy being replenished but it was more powerful than before. Perhaps he harmed himself because he was stronger than he thought but since he almost never used that holy power granted to him, he wasn't used to a such strong output of energy. "A training exercise will be most helpful to all of us right now..." He took the trays away before returning towards the table. "We need to gather out gear from our room but perhaps we can meet in the #training-hall ?" Bofwant told Vanilor before taking Sela's hand in his while they waited for the tiefling's answer.
Vanilor BOT 16-Jul-20 03:40 PM
”Splendid. I shall grab my equipment and meet you there.” Vanilor finished eating by his lonesome then returned to his room where’d change attires and prepare for their training.

Reese (Thrin✨Tomara✨Parker) 17-Jul-20 04:25 PM

Jad (: (Armi, Kalas, Volya) 17-Jul-20 08:52 PM

He quickly finishes the rest of his foods and puts everything into his backpack, including the now alive drone "Do you wanna head there now? Or should we wait a little?"
Reese (Thrin✨Tomara✨Parker) 17-Jul-20 10:20 PM

Avrae BOT 23-Jul-20 06:52 AM
Halanaestra Ellorenthi d’Phiarlan BOT 23-Jul-20 06:58 AM
Hal had felt that strange heat move over her body when Garg had mentioned dessert. The way he’d looked at her. The manner in which he’d uttered those words! Biting down on her lip, she then got up and padded towards the exit, glancing behind her to make sure the shark wasn’t too far behind. She’d lead the way down the corridor, still just wearing her impromptu bathing suit since it was all she had for now. Perhaps she’d need to speak to someone about acquiring clothing better suited to water. Something told the girl that she’d be spending more time in it now that the Captain was part of her life. It wasn’t long before they reached the mess hall. Again, Hal’s tummy rumbled and she giggled. “Perhaps we can grab a few things and then head off to my room?” she suggested, already moving to fill up a tray with some snacks. “Then we can eat in peace.” The girl smiled then, hands reaching for fruit and bread and cheeses. She looked up at Garg, anticipating him choosing some sort of meat as the highlight of his snack choices.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 23-Jul-20 06:58 AM
( @Mors | Garg | Bof )
Garg DreadStorm BOT 23-Jul-20 05:28 PM
Garg just grinned and followed the elf through the ship. Like any straight male his focus was on the teasing movements of the barely dressed elf's ass. He had to give it to her, she really had been hiding a great body behind those fancy clothes of her. Despite his lecherously thoughts he had reached the same conclusion as Hal, they needed to find proper clothes for her, clothes that wouldn't be a bother if they got in the water. After they reached the mess hall, he took his eyes away from his first mate and started to fill his tray with meat, this time picking the ones that were half cooked, just to change things a little since he has his fill of raw meat a while ago. He stopped what he was doing when he heard Hal's idea. "Sounds like a plan shadow girl." He told her with a grin, showing his sharp teeth. After he was done grabbing his food he picked up a jar full of fresh water and turned to look at the barely dressed elf. "Let's get going then."
Halanaestra Ellorenthi d’Phiarlan BOT 24-Jul-20 08:31 PM
Hal finished filling her tray and lastly grabbed a large glass full of juice. Once she set it down, her blue eyes saw the pitcher. So, she reached for that and put it on her tray as well. The girl turned towards Garg and gave him a sheepish look. But she nodded and then moved towards the exit, eager to just relax in her own private space with the Captain, while they casually munched on some snacks. It seemed the perfect way to end the afternoon. (Exit to #hals-room )

Darth 03-Aug-20 08:33 PM
After having dumped his belongings in his room, Darthorian wandered through the ship in search of food. After a few minutes of walking the ship's deck and looking curiously at it's undead crew, Darth finally remembered the words of the Captain. ''Think where you want to be and open any door'' he had said. And so Darth did just that only to find himself standing in the Mess Hall The rather sizeable muscular man walked in. He was covered in little more than some fur and leather, a metal plate covering his abdomen more so to serve as a belt to hold the cloth and fur covering his lower body together than for protection. His upper legs and feet were bare, only his lower legs were covered by fur and cloth. The man's scales were as white as snow, his eyes blood red and several scars were dotted across his body. Most peculiar was however the branding on his right chest which seemed to be a rune of some sort. Darth looked around the Mess Hall, it was painfully obvious he had never been here before as he slowly made his way to the buffet. He grabbed a plate and looked at all of the wonderful food that lay on display as his mouth started to water

Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 07-Aug-20 02:17 PM
(Uthal from #steel-forge ) Uthal had walked along the entirety of the ship, talking with Celia as the ship shifted ever so slightly around them, leading the friendly new pair to the place where any of the Steel Hearts could eat their fill. "This is the mess hall; if you ever want anything to eat, this is where you go." he would say; he still wasn't sure how they did it, but every day there was the smell of fresh cooked food. Spices, flavors and combinations from all across the land were here; there were many food items he did not recognize, but he would simply take some venison and fish along with a sizable bowl of berries and nuts. "I will usually eat this; it was a common diet among the Katho-Olavi. I believe the humans call it a 'go-to meal'. A rather fitting expression." he woudl then say to Celia.
Kor | Zed | Celia 07-Aug-20 02:49 PM
Celia already was smiling again at the sight of such a well stocked area, this abundance of food would be available to her often? This news was certainly well recieved as her eyes did survey the room curiously for the time being. "A go-to meal? Hmm...well it does seem to all be easy to carry around then. Easy to pack provisions and good hardy food all around." She softly chuckled and gently she pat at his arm. "I can see now how you got so tall and well formed, region and diet aside you must have trained quite exceptionally." A giggle passed her lips as soon enough she turned her attention from Uthal toward finding a hearty stew of sorts, meat, vegetables, decently seasoned, she seemed ecstatic to find something even as simple as this among all the strange foods. "Where might we sit? I know back at the Abbey that some of the other Sisters had a spot they'd chosen for lunch so I'll let you lead if that's the same here."
Pendragon, Rok, Hero 07-Aug-20 03:56 PM
"I think theres some by the stews" pendragon said drinking his chocolate milk. As the dragonborn came back and told his reason of joining "is that possiple for a elf to give birth to a drago-wait never mind theres magic like polymorph and folks like yuan ti exist. " he said "life finds a way"
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 07-Aug-20 05:00 PM
Uthal laughed a bit as she mentioned his being well-formed, "No, my height and build were gifts of the Mother of the Mountain, passed to me from my ancestors the Giants. Which I am thankful for, as I feel it has allowed me to train myself quite strenuously." That was a core belief; with the Goliaths being Giantkin, they believed that the Giants themselves were the primordial fragments of the mountains' collective strength. It explained to them their immense power, and how the Goliaths got to be so large compared to most other races. Uthal looked around as she asked where to sit; he had no real thoughts on the 'best seat', but he did like sitting near a window, so that he might look outside, watch the heavens roll past and the clouds roil around them as the ship cut through the air. "I don't particularly know if there's 'spots', but I do have a few areas I myself like to sit in. This way." Uthal replied, waiting for her to grab her food before leading her towards a pair of seats that seemed to be bathed in the light of the sun. Outside, Celia would see the view of the clouds, the rolling waves of white and blue that made up much of Uthal's time in the mountains. "This is how it looks atop the mountain where I was born and raised; every chance I find a place where I can look, I take it." he would say to Celia.
Darth 07-Aug-20 06:00 PM
Darthoria grabbed a mug and filled it with steaming hot water before walking back to his spot where his food awaited him. When the two strangers came in, he simply looked at them. "More comrades?" He asked with a smile before turning his attention to Penn again "Well my friend... some of the more puritan priests used to call me "Half-breed" in hushed tones. They were clearly disgusted by my existence" Darth merely shrugged before he continued his meal, after a few bites of meat he would pick up the mug of steaming hot water and simply gulp it down without trouble "Though they never spoke about my mother other than saying she was an Elf, they even said less about my father... though..." Darth looked at his hands and shrugged "I could take a pretty good guess what he was..."

Kor | Zed | Celia 07-Aug-20 11:54 PM
It would seem for now that Kor is opting to pet away at his dear Doggo since he's managed to finish his plate, eyes idly gazing over those present before eventually returning to Warrez. "That's a good lad." Celia meanwhile did happily join Uthal at his table. "The view is beautiful...your home must have been something breathtaking to see truly. Would it be too much to ask to see it one day perhaps? I know some are protective of the lands they call home so I wouldn't force you to ever show me such but...it sounds all so beautiful. My own home could hardly compare, wooden houses and simple greenery, it all seems so bland in comparison." Celia finally did take a spoon to her stew of meat and spice and vegetables. Her face was alight as she released a pleasured sigh from the initial bite. "So delectable." She would wiggle momentarily in her seat like a giddy child.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 08-Aug-20 08:32 PM
"It truly was." Uthal said, almost missing the second part to her question. "Not at all; I only wish to be stronger before I go back. Among the Katho-Olavi, all they ask is that if you leave the mountain camp, you come back stronger than before. Even then, it's not a requirement; most Goliaths are fairly wary of outsiders, but the Katho-Olavi do not have that fear, especially when it is kin. Few can live at the heights we call home." Taking a bite from his own venison, he then asked her, "Speaking of homes, perhaps that is something we could do one day. I could show you my home, and you could perhaps show me this coven? I'm curious to learn more about the Genasi, especially if they hail from the lineage of Genies as you mentioned."
Darth 09-Aug-20 04:01 PM
Darth looked at the pair that sat down at their own table. Learning the name of the Goliah from Penn. He then glanced at Kor who seemed to be content with just petting his dog. Darth listened to what Penn said before bursting out in hearty laughter at the kobold comment "Hah! Maybe he was!" Darth shook his head chuckling. "It's often been hinted at that he was a Dragon...but no one ever outright told me... there is this curious children's story though, maybe you know it". After speaking Darth made a gesture common to his religion "Oh and I am honoured to be in the presence of one with the blood of Celestials." He bowed his head at Penn
Kor | Zed | Celia 09-Aug-20 07:17 PM
Kor idly did watch the many others in the room, his eyes wandered slightly but he didn't dare butt into any conversations for the time being. He wasn't keen on being rude and honestly the Centaur was enjoying the peace. Meanwhile did Celia softly giggle. "No no no, not a coven...that's more the realm of...witches. I don't dare indulge in such magics or the like, The Light isn't keen on that particular side of things after all." Gently she pat Uthal's arm. "As for learning of my people...well you may do better to learn from books, I haven't a single other friend that shares my lineage or race, and neither parent would be capable of telling you anything else I'm afraid..." She let out a soft sigh before gently squeezing her hand lay against him. "My apologies that I cannot help on that front, I will try to make it up in some other way yes?" Again her smile radiated bright as always.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 09-Aug-20 08:42 PM
"Ah, my apologies; I thought I had heard you mention a Coven." he would say; though he cocked a brow as she explained that she had no others like her. So, she was a rarity among an already rare race? Were they hunted to extinction, or just extremely reclusive? "It is alright; I had no idea you were, as the humans say, 'one of a kind'. As for books....I am afraid I do not read very well." he would admit plainly; learning from history was not common among Goliaths at all. In fact many clans found relishing on ancient history to be a waste of time, his own included. The only writing they did was the tallying of great achievements to share among their clansmen. And when the record was broken, or an even larger one was announced? The old one was stricken away, now irrelevant as it had been surpassed. Patting her hand, he would say, "Consider it no trouble; as you said, we can think of something else." Taking another bite of his venison and fish, he would ask her, "But if I might ask...What exactly is this 'Light'? Is it a power like I've heard other temples preach of? I've met some armored warriors and some magic users who claim to answer to something beyond themselves. I only ask because...Well, I've found it kind of silly that people have to rely on someone else or something else, even when they clearly have had the strength within them."

Kor | Zed | Celia 10-Aug-20 05:42 PM

I sure don't need ta say anything, not my conversation that's being carried on innit?" He merely shook his head as Warrez spread out on the floor and let out a groan, lazy doggo. "Oh, you mean The Light? It is what I follow and the other members of the church. It is what we call upon to aid us. Strong as some of us may be we cannot simply produce these things on our own without the focus and discipline it helps to bring. I cannot hope to create light myself without following and learning of it after all...and even then what I make is a pale shadow in comparison to the true Light." She sighed a moment and gently pat his arm again. "It almost sounds storybook, but I have experienced these grand powers myself, they are far past what I could hope to accomplish by myself. It isn't quite like swinging an axe after all."

Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 12-Aug-20 12:25 AM
Uthal listened as Celia explained 'the Light'; he supposed he just didn't understand why people felt a need for such things. It was...kind of unsettling. His own bond could be construed as such, he supposed, but it was more his victory in his hunts that enabled him to absorb the strength of the bears that wandered the forest and even dared to climb mountains in some instances. Maybe it was just him not understanding religion or a set of beliefs from a pastoral or priestly point of view, and he would even say as she pat his arm, "Well, it is not my place to decide who follows what; I will not mock others for their beliefs, but I also will not pretend to understand what those beliefs are. I suppose I am simply too inexperienced with religion or deities to understand what it means, if what you say is true." Finishing off his meal, he would then finish with, "I did enjoy this talk with you, Celia Heartborn. It was...enlightening, yes I believe that is the word. And I would very much like to do it again at some point." And of course, being Uthal, he missed the pun he made entirely by accident.

My own name was fine but the sisters chose to give me the name Kindness for my actions, they all said it seemed rather fitting." She softly chuckled and shook her head. "I only did what was necessary and right during my time there."

Kor | Zed | Celia 23-Aug-20 12:38 PM

It is hard to explain, but I also don't know how to fix each emotion, I can only try my best. But that is what I shall do, try my best to be of benefit to this guild and the others here."

The young woman would give the half orc a good look up and down, he was right about the throw off but not in the way he may have thought, "Nice to meet you... The scent of curry filled her nostrils, actual food, it would be the first time she actually would have culinary items since she had arrive in this world, she kept herself refined despite the stimulation.
